pages.text: Tietasaura derbyiana hails from the Early Cretaceous, with fossils found in the Marfim Formation, Brazil. It is a small ornithopod, and grew up to 1.5 m in overall size. It is the first ornithischian to be named that comes from Brazil, and the first dinosaur remains to be found in South America overall.

The generic name derives from the fictional name 'Tieta', the name of the main character of the novel 'Tieta do Agreste'; and the Greek word 'sauros', to mean 'Lizard'. The specific name derives from the Latinised surname of Orville A. Derby, a geologist who contributed to Brazillian palaeontology.
